section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence is a structural flaw in text. The sentence does not make sense because of the grammatical errors.

section: Recipient shall own, and Provider hereby irrevocably assigns to the Recipient, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights and any other similar rights, in each case on a worldwide basis, and all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any part thereof, in whatever form or medium hereafter made or conceived solely or jointly by Provider while working for or on behalf of the Recipient, which relate to, is suggested by, or results from the Services.
explanation: The text is ambiguous in legal terms because it encompasses 'any invention...solely or jointly by Provider while working for or on behalf of the Recipient, which relate to, is suggested by, or results from the Services.' This is a broad statement that means that anything that the provider comes up with that has to do with the services, the recipent owns. This is a vague statement and hard to enforce under state or national law because what if the services is marketing and the provider comes up with a marketing strategy outside of work, the recipient owns that.

section: Upon termination of this Agreement in its entirety pursuant to Section 3.1, all obligations of the Parties hereto shall terminate, except for the provisions of Section 2.2, and the entirety of Sections 4, 5 and 6, which shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
explanation: There is an omission in the text. Section 3.6 outlines obligations of the provider upon termination. By stating that 'all obligations of the Parties hereto shall terminate' except certain sections, there is a contradiction because Section 3.6 contains obligations that should survive termination, but it's not explicitly stated as an exception. This creates an internal contradiction.
